title: Lost a ranked match: Sion afks "I had to go eat"
body:
So lost another match with a sion who waited till like 5 minutes into the match to afk. 
Doesnt return till about the 20-22 minute mark, the enemy already fed and in our base. 
His excuse "I had to go eat"
If you know you are gonna have to go
DONT QUEUE UP, Especially in ranked.

Just because "I had to go eat" is not an excuse for fucking over 4 other players on your team, leaving them a man short and ending up in a loss. 
If you know you have to leave or wont be able to commit the full match, DONT LOOK FOR A MATCH!!!! 
I dont want to lose matches because someone decides in the first 5 minutes of the match "y'know, I gotta go take a shower" and screws over the team. 

TLDR: If you cant stay the full match, if you think something is gonna come up. DONT QUE FOR A MATCH.

If you have parents that can't be reasoned with, fine, don't queue up until after dinner. Joining a game that you don't have a reasonable expectation of staying through is doing yourself and your fellow players an immense disservice, and if there's a chance mom's gonna call for dinner, you can't possible have that reasonable expectation. 

Please note that I'm not suggesting that somebody ignore their own parents if a situation arises. That's unreasonable. Shit happens. But I do think it's realistic to expect people to manage their time and their obligations in such a way that something like a family dinner doesn't suddenly pop up in the middle of a League match.

Contrary to popular belief, not eating does not make your body start eating away at the excess fat, making you skinny again. Not eating will in fact kill you. In a slow manner

You don't have to exercise to burn fat.... your body does it automatically. In fact it burns about 1200-1500 calories every single day without you lifting a finger or getting out of bed.
A lot of people manage to get obese and stay that way. Also, things like comas exist.

Yeah.. it's called your Basil Metabolic Rate (BMR) which is approximately 1200-1500 calories average (relative to the average male/female). Your BMR is the amount of energy (calories) required to keep all your basic metabolic systems running like your brain, your kidneys, lungs, if you were in coma. Since we're not in coma, we burn a few hundred more calories sitting around playing video games.

Obese people eat more calories than they burn, that's why they become obese. Not because they don't exercise. Exercising would help them burn more calories. Eating less than they burn would make them lose weight.
That's how people get fat, there's a big difference between getting fat and getting obese. I can't even fathom how it's possible to become obese.
